item.title: Spray markings paint, 3rd September
item.description:

item.title: Suspected Unlicensed HMO, 2nd September
item.description:
I would like to report a property that I believe is being used as an unlicensed House in Multiple Occupation (HMO). Address: 481 Blackfen Road, Sidcup, DA15 9NP The previous family left the property, and it now appears to be rented to multiple unrelated tenants. The outbuilding has been converted into a self-contained flat, and an additional room has been added within the main building. There is also a large amount of CCTV installed in and around the property. These changes, along with the frequent different occupants, suggest the house may be operating as an HMO without the required licence. This report is submitted anonymously. Best regards, A concerned resident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 510, Blackfen Road, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crowded pavement with all sort of parcels, fridges, and clutter in Peckham park Road, 2nd September
item.description:
The shops on that section of the street often use the pavement to store their parcels, which can lead to a crowded walkway filled with large boxes and clutter. This makes it challenging for pedestrians to navigate, especially during busy hours. I've observed this issue for several months, and with the schools reopening today, the situation has become even trickier during drop-off and collection times due to the increased foot traffic. It might be beneficial for the shops to consider more organized loading/unloading of their cargo that allow for better accessibility on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Peckham Park Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brecknock Road & Leighton Grove Pothole, 2nd September
item.description:
This pothole is on the corner of Brecknock Road and Leighton Grove. It’s on the road near Willbury House, Hilldrop Estate. When buses and large vehicles drive on it the flats in N7 0DA shake. The entire building shakes like a mini earthquake until the vehicle drives on. This occurs multiples times every hour and countless times a day. The family in the flat below me has a baby and it’s scary for them. Any help here would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Brecknock Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car left in same spot for 24 months, moves for MOT only., 2nd September
item.description:
Car left in same place all year round only moving for MOT. Council workers are unable to tend to grass and bushes now growing in the road again. The car makes the street look untidy and is rotting in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Annandale Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked for over 6 months, 2nd September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horn Park Lane, Horn Park, London
